article_node.title: Maps: Tracking Tropical Storm Lorena
article_node.summary: Tropical Storm Lorena, the 12th named storm of the Eastern Pacific 2025 season, is currently located near 18.3°N, 107.9°W and moving northwest at about 14 mph. Its maximum sustained winds have risen to 45 mph, with forecasts indicating potential strengthening to hurricane strength by Wednesday. The storm is expected to bring heavy rainfall and flash flooding to northwestern Mexico, including Baja California Sur, with possible rainfall totals of 4–8 inches and up to 12 inches in some areas. Local authorities are advised to monitor the system, as a Tropical‑Storm Watch could be issued for parts of Baja California Sur later in the week.
